column5: Here's a pic someone sent me.   This Sturgeon was caught on the LAKE OF THE WOODS , KENORA , ONTARIO two weeks ago. It weighed out at over 1,000 lbs (463.6 kg) and measured out at 11'1" (3.3563 meters). It was 56" around the girth and took over 6 and a half hours, and 4 dozen beers, for the 4 guys taking turns at reeling it in.  Any Sturgeon OVER about five feet has to be released unharmed and cannot be removed from the water.  They are brood / breeding stock and probably older than most of us.

im gonna go on a limb and say no... not caught on lake of the woods. looks like a white sturgeon to me, which doesnt reside in lake of the woods. that would be from BC on the fraser river most likely. gorgeous fish though
Lake of the Woods and every other lake on the planet.
That pic is a few years old - I believe it is from British Columbia.  A great pic none-the-less!

BC Fish - Fraser River if I recall correctly.  Gorgeous fish.  Pic has been floating around since the early 2000's.  Cue the pic of the huge pike that's been caught on almost every lake that holds pike in the last 5 years.....

the sturgeon in our chain are not white sturgeon, and they only get to about 7ft, and around 100lbs giver take. And most the sturgeon reside in the river, not in Rainy Lake or LOTW, although you can still incidentally catch them.  and size doesnt matter as far as I know??? None of them can be removed from the water nor can you target them, its closed all season
Who's got that picture ??? You know the one I mean .....  Roy ????
Which has been caught more times and in more lakes in Ontario... this strugeon or that infamous pike?
C'mon... seriously.  Get with the times man!
The good old..............'' someone '' from work sent me this pic  :wallbash:
face = palmed

I guess I'm the only one here who had never seen that pic before!  I'll tell the guy who sent me that---not that it matters. (At least I amused some of you momentarily!. Now, let's all go back to arguing about bass boats!)
Nah, it's more fun slammin some poor soul for holding a musky wrong
Or someone who believes everything he sees on the WWW.....
Lol awesome..Not even a member for a full year and your on it..funny stuff..Oh the stories of bass boats and Muskies..
that pike was caught at Island Lake Conservation area in Orangeville. They sure got some monsters up there.
You mean to say that some of the other stuff on WWW isn't true either???? Well, wait 'till I tell my friends that!(May I quote you?)
bud that pike was from mountsberg thats my uncle in the pic he sent me that pic and i posted it u can tell its mountsberg in the backgroung
